refined_goal: Build GitRecombo: a self-hosted, ultra-autonomous discovery engine that mines GitHub in near-real time, derives lightweight embeddings from code and docs, and spins up live, typed API harnesses against discovered services—then visualizes and A/B tests them in dual-skinned dashboards. Under the hood: a zero-ML-weight, memory-bounded embedding stack (random indexing + char n-gram SIF + MinHash/LSH) integrated into a Spring Boot orchestrator; Retrofit used as a dynamic type generator + probe runner with custom CallAdapter/Converter factories; Tabler and AdminLTE swapped on-the-fly via a CSS polyglot adapter. Success: <7s time-to-first-probe after discovery, <512MB RAM embedding pipeline, >0.72 F1 on relevance at k=20, and live endpoint validation across 200 repos/hour. Why it matters: it compresses the loop from "What’s out there?" to "I’m calling it now" into minutes—without heavyweight models—unlocking scalable, trustworthy recombination of open-source capability.
repository_synergy:
THE INSIGHT: Treat Retrofit not merely as an HTTP client but as a code generator for executable hypotheses. Pair it with a lightweight embedding engine that rapidly identifies promising repos/endpoints; then auto-synthesize Retrofit interfaces to probe those endpoints in parallel. Use Spring Boot as the orchestration substrate where discovery, typing, probing, and scoring become first-class pipelines. Wrap the results in a UI that can switch skins between Tabler and AdminLTE—turning human-in-the-loop sensemaking into a fast, pleasant, and consistent experience—while the engine evolves autonomously in the background.

THE STORY: Why these repos, not the obvious ones? We could have picked a classic vector database and a heavy LLM to parse READMEs, and a popular React admin boilerplate. Instead, we went iconoclastic: Retrofit (typically a mobile client) provides an annotation DSL and pluggable factories that are perfect for on-the-fly, strongly-typed probes from text-extracted endpoints—far safer than ad-hoc curl. Spring Boot gives a bulletproof, introspectable runtime with scheduling, Actuator metrics, and configuration that can run anywhere from laptop to serverless to k8s—ideal for continuous discovery. Tabler and AdminLTE, two different admin UI frameworks, become a comparative visualization surface; we create a polyglot CSS adapter so one dataset yields two experiences without changing the markup. That dual-skin A/B lets us catch cognitive and layout friction as the autonomous system scales.

THE SYNERGY: Lightweight embeddings decide what to try; Retrofit makes trying safe, fast, and typed; Spring orchestrates the feedback loop; Tabler/AdminLTE turn the outcomes into actionable dashboards. The illicit bridge is twofold:
- Retrofit ConverterFactory as vectorizer: we expose a logical endpoint (emb://) that looks like HTTP to Retrofit but is intercepted to run local embeddings. The same interface can later point to a real remote embedding service—with zero call-site change.
- A CSS polyglot adapter that maps shared component primitives (cards, nav, tables, badges) to either Tabler or AdminLTE via custom properties and class aliasing. One semantic UI, two skins, runtime-switchable.

THE INNOVATION: This stack makes synthesis cheap: each discovered repo yields structured signals (novelty, health, relevance, diversity), a typed hypothesis (Retrofit interface), immediate validation runs, and a human-visible dashboard of what’s promising. The move from brittle scraping to typed interface probes is the key: we leverage Retrofit’s annotation DSL to codify assumptions we can refute quickly. Tabler/AdminLTE are not just themes—they’re levers for operator cognition. Spring Boot stitches this into a continuous, observable machine. The payoff: a system that recombines open-source capability at scale without heavyweight models, and that can later swap in heavier semantics without a rewrite.
technical_architecture:
Components and flow:
- Ingestor (Spring Boot): Schedules GitHub scans via Retrofit-based GitHub API clients. Applies ETag and conditional requests to minimize rate usage; OkHttp connection pooling for throughput.
- Parser/Signalizer: Extracts candidate endpoints from READMEs, OpenAPI files, code comments, and package manifests using fast regex + heuristic tokenizers. Computes signals: novelty (n-gram rarity), health (stars, commits, issues), author (org/user heuristics), semantic relevance (light embedding cosine), diversity (LSH collision reduction).
- Lightweight Embedding Engine: Random Indexing of char 3–5-grams into 2048-dim sparse vectors; SIF weighting by inverse n-gram frequency; optional power-iteration to de-bias principal directions on batches. MinHash signatures for LSH; HNSW-lite or LSH Forest for ANN search. All in-memory with ring-buffer persistence; <512MB target.
- Retrofit Hypothesis Builder: Synthesizes Java interfaces from extracted endpoints. A small template engine assembles @GET/@POST methods with @Path/@Query from pattern-mined parameters. Type safety via conservative defaults (String/Map) on unknowns; evolves if OpenAPI discovered.
- Dual Retrofit Fabric: Two custom factories:
  1) ConverterFactory emb:// for local vectorization calls (Retrofit treats it as an endpoint, OkHttp interceptor routes scheme to in-process module). Enables composability with call adapters, retries, and metrics.
  2) CallAdapterFactory for probe scheduling that wraps each call in circuit breakers, backoff, and SLA timers; supports streaming via Server-Sent Events.
- Probe Runner: Executes synthesized APIs against candidate endpoints, validates status codes, schema hints, auth requirements, pagination behaviors, and rate limits. Stores metrics in a compact store (H2/SQLite via Spring Data).
- Orchestrator/Scoring: Combines probe outcomes with signals to re-rank candidates. Diversity-aware selection uses LSH buckets to avoid near-duplicates. Decision engine defines next probes within rate limits.
- UI Webapp: Spring MVC + Thymeleaf templates with semantic CSS classes. Runtime theme switcher injects either Tabler or AdminLTE bundles. CSS polyglot adapter defines a map of semantic classes (ui-card, ui-badge, ui-table) to framework classes and variables. SSE feeds live logs/metrics.
- Storage/Indexing: Lightweight KV for vectors and signatures; relational tables for repos, endpoints, probes, metrics. Snapshot writer for exporting to parquet/CSV.

Key technical choices and optimizations:
- Retrofit on server-side: chosen for its annotation DSL and pluggable factories; dramatically simplifies typed probing vs hand-rolled clients.
- Virtual host interceptor: gh://owner/repo/path mapped to locally cached blobs; OkHttp fetches from cache or falls back to raw.githubusercontent.com with ETag, making content access uniform.
- Backpressure: SSE emits bounded buffers; probe runner uses bounded thread pools plus GitHub token-bucket rate limiter; sampling tuned to maintain <2% 429 responses.
- Search and ranking: Two-stage retrieval—LSH/ANN to shortlist 200 repos, then exact cosine with SIF embeddings for top-k; rerank with novelty and health weights to meet blueprint.
- Safety net: Probes default to HEAD/OPTIONS before GET/POST; timeouts <2s; content sniffing prevents accidental large downloads.
- Interfaces/APIs:
  - /api/ingest?topics=...&days=7 triggers scan
  - /api/search?q=... returns candidates with vectors and signals
  - /api/probe/{repo}/{endpointId} runs or re-runs a probe
  - /api/themes/current GET/POST to switch Tabler/AdminLTE
  - /api/metrics/stream SSE for progress and errors
- Why Spring Boot: Actuator provides health and metrics; Scheduling and Conditional beans keep modules swappable; testcontainers-ready. Why dual CSS frameworks: validates cognitive ergonomics and maintains UI resilience.

Security and compliance:
- GitHub tokens in Spring Vault-compatible property sources; per-request scope.
- Sanitization of logs and URLs; no exfiltration of secrets in probe output.
- License awareness: store repo license and restrict probes if incompatible with policy.

Migration path: The emb:// converter can later redirect to an external embedding microservice; the UI can swap in a modern SPA without back-end changes; the Retrofit interfaces can be exported as OpenAPI via reflective inspection.
expected_impact:
Use cases uniquely enabled by this combo:
- Instant typed harness for emergent APIs: A new repo publishes a draft HTTP interface in its README. Within minutes, GitRecombo synthesizes a Retrofit interface, probes OPTIONS/HEAD, validates CORS and auth hints, and surfaces a working call snippet. Operators can fire a live call and view structured results without writing any client code.
- Dual-skin operator cockpit: Analysts compare discovery outcomes in Tabler vs AdminLTE in real time. The same semantic markup renders into different visual hierarchies; the team measures which skin yields faster triage (lower dwell time per decision) and keeps that data.
- Lightweight embedding bake-off: Toggle between random indexing + SIF and MinHash-only modes on a weekly crawl. Measure precision@k and time-to-first-probe to demonstrate that sub-512MB embeddings can outperform naive keyword search for this domain.
- API drift radar: The probe runner schedules periodic validations on previously good endpoints. Retrofit’s typed contracts reveal breaking changes immediately; the UI highlights drifts and proposes updated method signatures.
- Corporate OSS triage: Point the ingestor at internal GitHub Enterprise. Within the confines of a network perimeter, teams get automated clients and dashboards for internal services—no heavyweight ML stack required.
- Offline edge scouting: Ship the orchestrator to air-gapped environments with pre-snapshotted repos. emb:// keeps embeddings local. Discovery and probing continue offline; results sync when connectivity returns.
- Diversity-aware exploration: The LSH-driven reranker avoids clusters of near-duplicate libraries, pushing truly different candidates to the surface—exactly the kind of surprise that spurs recombination.

Scalability and extensibility:
- Horizontal scale out by sharding ANN/LSH indices and probe pools.
- Embedding module can be hot-swapped to a remote service with no API change.
- UI themes are pluggable by adding a new CSS map; semantics remain stable.

Limitations and mitigations:
- Heuristic endpoint extraction can hallucinate parameters; mitigation: conservative default types, OPTIONS sniffing, and human review checkpoints.
- GitHub rate limits: mitigate via ETag caching, multi-token rotation, and backoff.
- CSS collisions: the polyglot adapter may miss edge cases; add visual regression tests and allow per-component overrides.
- Dynamic Retrofit typing is inherently lossy without schemas; when OpenAPI is found, prioritize it to refine interfaces.
innovation_analysis:
Innovation score: 8.6/10. It repurposes Retrofit as an executable hypothesis engine, fuses it with a zero-ML-weight embedding pipeline, and treats dual CSS frameworks as an ergonomic switch—non-obvious, synergistic, and practical.

Immediate next steps:
- Implement emb:// ConverterFactory and VirtualHost Interceptor.
- Build the semantic CSS map and runtime theme switcher.
- Stand up the ingest → embed → LSH shortlist → Retrofit synthesize → probe pipeline with Actuator metrics and SSE.
- Run a 7-day crawl of targeted topics; collect precision@k, time-to-first-probe, and probe success rates.

Key metrics:
- Relevance@20 (precision/F1), unique-service discovery rate/day, probe success ratio, average time-to-first-probe, RAM footprint of embedding engine, operator decision dwell time per candidate.

Essential tools/frameworks:
- Spring Boot (web, actuator, data), Retrofit + OkHttp, H2/SQLite, Thymeleaf, Tabler + AdminLTE assets, JMH for microbenchmarks, WireMock for probe tests, Testcontainers for integration, GitHub REST via Retrofit. This stack can prove the thesis quickly and scale responsibly.

sources.name: spring-projects/spring-boot
sources.readme_snippet:
= Spring Boot image:https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/actions/workflows/build-and-deploy-snapshot.yml/badge.svg?branch=main["Build Status", link="https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/actions/workflows/build-and-deploy-snapshot.yml?query=branch%3Amain"] image:https://img.shields.io/badge/Revved%20up%20by-Develocity-06A0CE?logo=Gradle&labelColor=02303A["Revved up by Develocity", link="https://ge.spring.io/scans?&search.rootProjectNames=Spring%20Boot%20Build&search.rootProjectNames=spring-boot-build"]

:docs: https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot
:github: https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot

Spring Boot helps you to create Spring-powered, production-grade applications and services with absolute minimum fuss.
It takes an opinionated view of the Spring platform so that new and existing users can quickly get to the bits they need.

You can use Spring Boot to create stand-alone Java applications that can be started using `java -jar` or more traditional WAR deployments.
We also provide a command-line tool that runs Spring scripts.

Our primary goals are:

* Provide a radically faster and widely accessible getting started experience for all Spring development.
* Be opinionated, but get out of the way quickly as requirements start to diverge from the defaults.
* Provide a range of non-functional features common to large classes of projects (for example, embedded servers, security, metrics, health checks, externalized configuration).
* Absolutely no code generation and no requirement for XML configuration.



== Installation and Getting Started

The {docs}[reference documentation] includes detailed {docs}/installing.html[installation instructions] as well as a comprehensive {docs}/tutorial/first-application/index.html[``getting started``] guide.

Here is a quick teaser of a complete Spring Boot application in Java:

[source,java]
----
import org.springframework.boot.*;
import org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.*;
import org.springframework.we

sources.name: square/retrofit
sources.readme_snippet:
Retrofit
========

A type-safe HTTP client for Android and Java.

For more information please see [the website][1].


Download
--------

Download [the latest JAR][2] or grab from Maven central at the coordinates `com.squareup.retrofit2:retrofit:3.0.0`.

Snapshots of the development version are available in [Sonatype's `snapshots` repository][snap].

Retrofit requires at minimum Java 8+ or Android API 21+.


R8 / ProGuard
-------------

If you are using R8 the shrinking and obfuscation rules are included automatically.

ProGuard users must manually add the options from
[retrofit2.pro][proguard file].
You might also need [rules for OkHttp][okhttp proguard] which is a dependency of this library.


License
=======

    Copyright 2013 Square, Inc.

    Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
    you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
    You may obtain a copy of the License at

       http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0

    Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
    distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
    WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
    See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
    limitations under the License.


 [1]: https://square.github.io/retrofit/
 [2]: https://search.maven.org/remote_content?g=com.squareup.retrofit2&a=retrofit&v=LATEST
 [snap]: https://s01.oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots/
 [proguard file]: https://github.com/square/retrofit/blob/master/retrofit/src/main/resources/META-INF/proguard/retrofit2.pro
 [okhttp proguard]: https://square.github.io/okhttp/r8_proguard/
 [okio proguard]: https://square.github.io/okio/#r8-proguard

sources.name: ColorlibHQ/AdminLTE
sources.readme_snippet:
# [AdminLTE - Bootstrap 5 Admin Dashboard](https://adminlte.io)

[![npm version](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/admin-lte/latest.svg)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/admin-lte)
[![Packagist](https://img.shields.io/packagist/v/almasaeed2010/adminlte.svg)](https://packagist.org/packages/almasaeed2010/adminlte)
[![cdn version](https://data.jsdelivr.com/v1/package/npm/admin-lte/badge)](https://www.jsdelivr.com/package/npm/admin-lte)
[![Discord Invite](https://img.shields.io/badge/discord-join%20now-green)](https://discord.gg/jfdvjwFqfz)
[![Netlify Status](https://api.netlify.com/api/v1/badges/1277b36b-08f3-43fa-826a-4b4d24614b3c/deploy-status)](https://app.netlify.com/sites/adminlte-v4/deploys)

**AdminLTE** is a fully responsive administration template. Based on **[Bootstrap 5](https://getbootstrap.com/)** framework and also the JavaScript plugins.
Highly customizable and easy to use. Fits many screen resolutions from small mobile devices to large desktops.

## What's New in v4.0.0-rc5

**Latest Release with Major Dependency Updates & Security Fixes** - Fresh improvements for better development experience:

- **Major Dependency Updates** - 17+ npm packages updated to latest versions
- **Security Enhancements** - Fixed 2 critical vulnerabilities (axios DoS, form-data random function)
- **Latest Tooling** - Updated to TypeScript 5.9.3, ESLint 9.37.0, Astro 5.14.4, and more
- **Bootstrap 5.3.8** - Updated to the latest stable Bootstrap release
- **ESLint 9.x Compatibility** - Removed deprecated `.eslintignore` file
- **Zero Vulnerabilities** - All security issues resolved

**Key Improvements:**
- ✅ All dependencies updated to their absolute latest versions
- ✅ Two major version bumps: cross-env 10.x and eslint-config-xo-typescript 9.x
- ✅ Enhanced security with vulnerability fixes
- ✅ Cleaner linting without deprecation warnings
- ✅ Production-ready with enhanced stability
- ✅ Faster builds with latest Rollup, Sass, and Terser

**Install the latest:**
```bash
npm install adm

discovery_params.goal: Test ultra_autonomous discovery with lightweight embedding

blueprint.title: GitRecombo — Out‑of‑Scale Blueprint
blueprint.summary: Recombination of recent GitHub innovations with long-tail exploration, health/reputation signals, and optional semantic relevance.
why_it_works: Novelty + Health + Author signals + Semantic relevance elevate hidden gems.
Diversity bonus avoids conceptual duplicates when embeddings are enabled.
Permissive licensing keeps integration safe and fast.
